input.content:
#!/bin/bash

working_domains=""
failed_domains=""

while read domain; do
    echo "Testing $domain..."
    response=$(curl -s -o /dev/null -w "%{http_code}" --connect-timeout 10 --max-time 15 "http://$domain" 2>/dev/null)
    
    if [ "$response" = "200" ] || [ "$response" = "301" ] || [ "$response" = "302" ]; then
        echo "$domain: OK ($response)"
        working_domains="$working_domains$domain\n"
    else
        echo "$domain: FAILED ($response)"
        failed_domains="$failed_domains$domain ($response)\n"
    fi
done < temp_domains.txt

echo -e "$working_domains" > working_domains.txt
echo -e "\n--- SUMMARY ---"
echo "Working domains saved to working_domains.txt"
echo "Failed domains:"
echo -e "$failed_domains"

#!/bin/bash

working_domains=""
failed_domains=""

while read domain; do
    echo "Testing $domain..."
    response=$(curl -s -o /dev/null -w "%{http_code}" --connect-timeout 10 --max-time 15 "http://$domain" 2>/dev/null)
    
    if [ "$response" = "200" ] || [ "$response" = "301" ] || [ "$response" = "302" ]; then
        echo "$domain: OK ($response)"
        working_domains="$working_domains$domain\n"
    else
        echo "$domain: FAILED ($response)"
        failed_domains="$failed_domains$domain ($response)\n"
    fi
done < temp_domains.txt

echo -e "$working_domains" > working_domains.txt
echo -e "\n--- SUMMARY ---"
echo "Working domains saved to working_domains.txt"
echo "Failed domains:"
echo -e "$failed_domains"

# Romania News: Newspapers, News Platforms, New Media

by [Lobby Romania](https://lobbyromania.ro/author/panoucontrol/)/ sâmbătă, 06 mai 2023 / Published in [News](https://lobbyromania.ro/category/news/)

[![Romania News](https://lobbyromania.ro/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/Romania-newspapers-420x280_c.jpg)](https://lobbyromania.ro/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/Romania-newspapers.jpg)

For those following us for a while, you all know we try to cover all aspects of Romanian news, from politics and economics, and all that happens in Romania and matters to European and worldwide lobbyists.

We cannot cover all the Romanian news, though. Anybody who wants to stay up-to-date with the latest news from Romania might do so by exploring various print newspapers, online news platforms, and new media that we present here today. Most of them have English versions, so switching to English at any time on their online platforms would be easier.

In this article, we’ll take a closer look at some of the top sources for news from Romania across different mediums.

## Romania News in English

### Romania Insider

[Romania Insider](https://www.romania-insider.com/) is a leading English-language news source in Romania that provides daily updates on politics, business, culture, and travel. They have a team of experienced journalists covering a wide range of topics, ensuring readers get a comprehensive view of what’s happening in Romania.

They miss the in-depth analysis of subjects, as they keep anything at the fact level, without any comments or internal opinions, in any direction. While on their platform, news can be read but also missed equally. This is why we always say Romania Insider is the best source of news but not of information, and this is quite a difference.

### Valahia News

[Valahia News](https://valahia.news) is another English-language news platform covering Romania’s latest news. They focus on politics, economy, culture, and sports. Their well-researched articles provide in-depth analysis, making them a go-to source for news enthusiasts. We noticed some of their articles are documented extensively, presenting facts and what happens behind the scenes.

Notably, Valahia News was chosen by [Visit Bucharest](https://visitbucharest.today) as their media partner, so this might explain why they are among the preferred English news platforms in Romania. Also, we check their platform for opinions on what’s happening in Romania, as they tend to present everything more casually and more friendly.

### Romania Journal

[The Romania Journal](https://www.romaniajournal.ro/) is a daily news portal in English covering all aspects of Romanian society, politics, economy, sports, and culture. They also have a team of journalists who provide high-quality news coverage emphasizing accuracy and objectivity.

      "text": "The **mass media in Romania** refers to [mass media](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mass_media) outlets based in [Romania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romania). Television, magazines, and newspapers are all operated by both state-owned and for-profit corporations which depend on [advertising](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Advertising), [subscription](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Subscription), and other sales-related revenues. The [Constitution of Romania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Romania) guarantees freedom of speech. As a [country in transition](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Country_in_transition), the Romanian media system is under transformation.

[Reporters Without Borders](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reporters_Without_Borders) ranks Romania 42nd in its [Worldwide Press Freedom Index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Press_Freedom_Index), from 2013.[\[1\]](http://en.wikipedia.org/en.wikipedia.org#cite_note-1) [Freedom House](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freedom_House) ranked it as "partly free" in 2014.[\[2\]](http://en.wikipedia.org/en.wikipedia.org#cite_note-FH-2)

Romania's newspaper market thrived after the 1989 revolution, but many newspapers subsequently closed because of rising costs. Most households in Bucharest have cable TV. There are hundreds of cable distributors offering access to Romanian, [European](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Union) and other stations.

According to europaworld.com, in 2004 there were:[\[3\]](http://en.wikipedia.org/en.wikipedia.org#cite_note-Europaworld-3)

- radio users: 5,369,000
- television users: 5,822,000
- telephones (main lines in use): 4,390,800 (2005)
- mobile cellular phones (subscribers): 22,000,000 (2008)
- personal computers: 2,450,000
- internet users: 4,500,000
- book production (inclusively pamphlets): 13,288,000 titles and 9,288,000 copies
- daily newspapers: 84
- other periodicals: 2,036

## Legislative framework

\[ [edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Mass_media_in_Romania&action=edit&section=2)\]

The 2003 [Constitution of Romania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Romania) upholds [freedom of expression](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freedom_of_expression) and prohibits [censorship](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Censorship). The Constitution also states that "Freedom of the press also involves the free setting up of publications," and that "No publication shall be suppressed, establishes free [access to information](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Access_to_information) and the autonomy of the public radio and TV.[\[4\]](http://en.wikipedia.org/en.wikipedia.org#cite_note-EJClex-4)

No specific Press Law is in force in Romania.[\[4\]](http://en.wikipedia.org/en.wikipedia.org#cite_note-EJClex-4) [Hate speech](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hate_speech) is forbidden when it insults state symbols or religion, and when it promotes fascist or racist ideologies. # Romania News: Newspapers, News Platforms, New Media

by [Lobby Romania](https://lobbyromania.ro/author/panoucontrol/)/ sâmbătă, 06 mai 2023 / Published in [News](https://lobbyromania.ro/category/news/)

[![Romania News](https://lobbyromania.ro/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/Romania-newspapers-420x280_c.jpg)](https://lobbyromania.ro/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/Romania-newspapers.jpg)

For those following us for a while, you all know we try to cover all aspects of Romanian news, from politics and economics, and all that happens in Romania and matters to European and worldwide lobbyists.

We cannot cover all the Romanian news, though. Anybody who wants to stay up-to-date with the latest news from Romania might do so by exploring various print newspapers, online news platforms, and new media that we present here today. Most of them have English versions, so switching to English at any time on their online platforms would be easier.

In this article, we’ll take a closer look at some of the top sources for news from Romania across different mediums.

## Romania News in English

### Romania Insider

[Romania Insider](https://www.romania-insider.com/) is a leading English-language news source in Romania that provides daily updates on politics, business, culture, and travel. They have a team of experienced journalists covering a wide range of topics, ensuring readers get a comprehensive view of what’s happening in Romania.

They miss the in-depth analysis of subjects, as they keep anything at the fact level, without any comments or internal opinions, in any direction. While on their platform, news can be read but also missed equally. This is why we always say Romania Insider is the best source of news but not of information, and this is quite a difference.

### Valahia News

[Valahia News](https://valahia.news) is another English-language news platform covering Romania’s latest news. They focus on politics, economy, culture, and sports. Their well-researched articles provide in-depth analysis, making them a go-to source for news enthusiasts. We noticed some of their articles are documented extensively, presenting facts and what happens behind the scenes.

Notably, Valahia News was chosen by [Visit Bucharest](https://visitbucharest.today) as their media partner, so this might explain why they are among the preferred English news platforms in Romania. Also, we check their platform for opinions on what’s happening in Romania, as they tend to present everything more casually and more friendly.

### Romania Journal

[The Romania Journal](https://www.romaniajournal.ro/) is a daily news portal in English covering all aspects of Romanian society, politics, economy, sports, and culture. They also have a team of journalists who provide high-quality news coverage emphasizing accuracy and objectivity.

      "text": "The **mass media in Romania** refers to [mass media](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mass_media) outlets based in [Romania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romania). The [Constitution of Romania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Romania) guarantees freedom of speech. As a [country in transition](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Country_in_transition), the Romanian media system is under transformation.

[Reporters Without Borders](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reporters_Without_Borders) ranks Romania 42nd in its [Worldwide Press Freedom Index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Press_Freedom_Index), from 2013.[\[1\]](http://en.wikipedia.org/en.wikipedia.org#cite_note-1) [Freedom House](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freedom_House) ranked it as "partly free" in 2014.[\[2\]](http://en.wikipedia.org/en.wikipedia.org#cite_note-FH-2)

Romania's newspaper market thrived after the 1989 revolution, but many newspapers subsequently closed because of rising costs. Most households in Bucharest have cable TV. There are hundreds of cable distributors offering access to Romanian, [European](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Union) and other stations.

According to europaworld.com, in 2004 there were:[\[3\]](http://en.wikipedia.org/en.wikipedia.org#cite_note-Europaworld-3)

- radio users: 5,369,000
- television users: 5,822,000
- telephones (main lines in use): 4,390,800 (2005)
- mobile cellular phones (subscribers): 22,000,000 (2008)
- personal computers: 2,450,000
- internet users: 4,500,000
- book production (inclusively pamphlets): 13,288,000 titles and 9,288,000 copies
- daily newspapers: 84
- other periodicals: 2,036

## Legislative framework

\[ [edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Mass_media_in_Romania&action=edit&section=2)\]

The 2003 [Constitution of Romania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Constitution_of_Romania) upholds [freedom of expression](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freedom_of_expression) and prohibits [censorship](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Censorship). The Constitution also states that "Freedom of the press also involves the free setting up of publications," and that "No publication shall be suppressed, establishes free [access to information](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Access_to_information) and the autonomy of the public radio and TV.[\[4\]](http://en.wikipedia.org/en.wikipedia.org#cite_note-EJClex-4)

No specific Press Law is in force in Romania.[\[4\]](http://en.wikipedia.org/en.wikipedia.org#cite_note-EJClex-4) [Hate speech](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hate_speech) is forbidden when it insults state symbols or religion, and when it promotes fascist or racist ideologies.       "text": "## Încă 17 persoane amendate după ce au fost filmate aruncând deșeuri pe marginea drumurilor naționale din Bihor

2 August 2022 09:53
Reactualizat la:
2 August 2022 09:58

CJ Bihor anunță că, în perioada aprilie - iunie, 17 persoane au fost surprinse de camerele de supraveghere video în timp ce aruncau deșeuri în locuri neamenajate.

-CJ Bihor anunță că, în perioada aprilie - iunie, 17 persoane au fost surprinse de camerele de supraveghere video în timp ce aruncau deșeuri în locuri neamenajate.

Toți șoferii au fost identificați de Poliție și mai apoi sancționați cu amenzi în valoare totală de 115.000 lei, în baza Ordonanței de Urgență 92/2021 privind regimul deșeurilor. Majoritatea celor care au încălcat legea sunt din Bihor, dar au fost identificați și șoferi conducând autovehicule înmatriculate în județele Sălaj, Arad și Hunedoara.

\[eadvert\]

### **9 camere video**

La finalul lunii aprilie au fost montate nouă camere video pentru supravegherea a cinci parcări de pe drumurile naționale din Bihor. Acesta este un proiect-pilot pe care Consiliul Județean Bihor și alte instituții partenere îl implementează cu scopul de a menține curățenia în județul nostru.

CJ Bihor dezvăluie și mecanismul prin care funcționează supravegherea video a parcărilor.

„La finalul lunii martie a fost încheiat un protocol de colaborare între (1) Consiliul Județean Bihor, (2) Inspectoratul de Poliție Județean Bihor (IPJ Bihor), (3) Direcția Regională de Drumuri și Poduri Cluj (DRDP Cluj) din cadrul Companiei Naționale de Administrare a Infrastructurii Rutiere (CNAIR), (4) Societatea RCS&RCS și (5) Societatea BITROOT SOLUTION.

Conform protocolului de colaborare, firma Bitroot Solution pune la dispoziție gratuit camerele video pentru supravegherea parcărilor de pe drumurile naționale din Bihor, în timp ce compania RCS&RDS asigură conexiunea la internet.

DRDP Cluj are rolul de a identifica parcările unde se depozitează frecvent deșeuri. IPJ Bihor a preluat în comodat camerele de supraveghere video, le monitorizează permanent și organizează echipe mixte cu Comisariatul Județean Bihor al Gărzii Naționale de Mediu pentru aplicarea măsurilor necesare.

Consiliul Județean Bihor monitorizează, de asemenea, camerele video și transmite către autoritățile competente informațiile de interes. Totodată, colaborează cu partenerii și primăriile din județ pentru punerea în aplicare a protocolului”, transmite CJ Bihor.

Pe lângă parcările de pe drumurile din județ, CJ Bihor a montat camere video și în Defileul Crișului Repede, cu scopul de a descuraja depozitarea ilegală a deșeurilor.",

![ Ziarul de Vrancea a disparut, ieri, din chioscuri!](https://stzdiprodwesteu.blob.core.windows.net/zdiprod/2024/03/image_placeholder_extra_large.jpg)

„Ziarul de Vrancea” a fost cumparat „en gros” cu doua zile inainte de alegerile parlamentare din 28 noiembrie. Ieri dimineata, in jurul orei 10.00, atit la chioscurile Rodipet cit si la cele proprii de difuzare, vinzatorii ramasesera fara nici un exemplar din „Ziarul de Vrancea”. Se pare ca cineva nu a dorit ca publicatia noastra sa fie citita de alegatorul vrincean, cu doua zile inainte de alegeri, mai ales ca vineri a fost ultima zi in care partidele politice mai puteau sa-si faca publice mesajele electorale prin intermediul presei. Vinzatorii au vindut, dupa cum ne-au declarat, si cite 50 de ziare deodata, unei singure persoane, care a solicitat „Ziarul de Vrancea” „cu bratul”. La ora 12.00, cititorilor care intrebau la chiscuri, la volanti sau la tarabe, de „Ziarul de Vrancea”, li se raspundea de catre vinzatori sau volanti, dind din umeri, ca s-au epuizat la primele ore ale diminetii. Doar clientii fideli ai vinzatoarelor de la chioscurile Rodipet au mai putut intra in posesia unui exemplar din publicatia noastra, pentru ca vinzatoarele le-au pastrat si le-au dat „pe sub mina”. Vinzatoarele ne-au spus ca de cind sint angajate la chioscurile de ziare nu li s-a mai intimplat ca tirajul primit de la „Ziarul de Vrancea” sa fie epuizat in mai putin de jumatate de ora. „Indiferent cine ar veni, nu dau mai mult de zece ziare! _Monitorul de Cluj_

_**Monitorul de Cluj**_ is a [Romanian language](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romanian_language) daily newspaper published in [Cluj-Napoca](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cluj-Napoca), [Romania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romania). It was first published in 26 June 1998. It is currently published by SC Monitorul de Cluj SRL, a privately owned company from Cluj-Napoca. Monitorul de Cluj is part of the media group Monitorul-Mesagerul, which is publishing the weeklies [Mesagerul de Sibiu](http://mesageruldesibiu.ro) (print and on-line), Monitorul de Arieș (print edition only), Monitorul de Mediaș (print and on-line) and [Mesagerul de Alba](http://mesageruldealba.ro) (on-line).

Monitorul de Cluj is the most read news portal in Cluj, the online extension of the daily newspaper, which has been published in Cluj since 1998. It publishes daily, in real time (24 hours a day, 7 days a week), news, reports, interviews, analyzes and investigations about all events in [Cluj County](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cluj_County), in Romania, and around the world.

      "text": "## Încă 17 persoane amendate după ce au fost filmate aruncând deșeuri pe marginea drumurilor naționale din Bihor

2 August 2022 09:53
Reactualizat la:
2 August 2022 09:58

CJ Bihor anunță că, în perioada aprilie - iunie, 17 persoane au fost surprinse de camerele de supraveghere video în timp ce aruncau deșeuri în locuri neamenajate.

-CJ Bihor anunță că, în perioada aprilie - iunie, 17 persoane au fost surprinse de camerele de supraveghere video în timp ce aruncau deșeuri în locuri neamenajate.

Toți șoferii au fost identificați de Poliție și mai apoi sancționați cu amenzi în valoare totală de 115.000 lei, în baza Ordonanței de Urgență 92/2021 privind regimul deșeurilor. Majoritatea celor care au încălcat legea sunt din Bihor, dar au fost identificați și șoferi conducând autovehicule înmatriculate în județele Sălaj, Arad și Hunedoara.

\[eadvert\]

### **9 camere video**

La finalul lunii aprilie au fost montate nouă camere video pentru supravegherea a cinci parcări de pe drumurile naționale din Bihor. Acesta este un proiect-pilot pe care Consiliul Județean Bihor și alte instituții partenere îl implementează cu scopul de a menține curățenia în județul nostru.

CJ Bihor dezvăluie și mecanismul prin care funcționează supravegherea video a parcărilor.

„La finalul lunii martie a fost încheiat un protocol de colaborare între (1) Consiliul Județean Bihor, (2) Inspectoratul de Poliție Județean Bihor (IPJ Bihor), (3) Direcția Regională de Drumuri și Poduri Cluj (DRDP Cluj) din cadrul Companiei Naționale de Administrare a Infrastructurii Rutiere (CNAIR), (4) Societatea RCS&RCS și (5) Societatea BITROOT SOLUTION.

Conform protocolului de colaborare, firma Bitroot Solution pune la dispoziție gratuit camerele video pentru supravegherea parcărilor de pe drumurile naționale din Bihor, în timp ce compania RCS&RDS asigură conexiunea la internet.

DRDP Cluj are rolul de a identifica parcările unde se depozitează frecvent deșeuri. IPJ Bihor a preluat în comodat camerele de supraveghere video, le monitorizează permanent și organizează echipe mixte cu Comisariatul Județean Bihor al Gărzii Naționale de Mediu pentru aplicarea măsurilor necesare.

Consiliul Județean Bihor monitorizează, de asemenea, camerele video și transmite către autoritățile competente informațiile de interes. Totodată, colaborează cu partenerii și primăriile din județ pentru punerea în aplicare a protocolului”, transmite CJ Bihor.

Pe lângă parcările de pe drumurile din județ, CJ Bihor a montat camere video și în Defileul Crișului Repede, cu scopul de a descuraja depozitarea ilegală a deșeurilor.",

![ Ziarul de Vrancea a disparut, ieri, din chioscuri!](https://stzdiprodwesteu.blob.core.windows.net/zdiprod/2024/03/image_placeholder_extra_large.jpg)

„Ziarul de Vrancea” a fost cumparat „en gros” cu doua zile inainte de alegerile parlamentare din 28 noiembrie. Ieri dimineata, in jurul orei 10.00, atit la chioscurile Rodipet cit si la cele proprii de difuzare, vinzatorii ramasesera fara nici un exemplar din „Ziarul de Vrancea”. Se pare ca cineva nu a dorit ca publicatia noastra sa fie citita de alegatorul vrincean, cu doua zile inainte de alegeri, mai ales ca vineri a fost ultima zi in care partidele politice mai puteau sa-si faca publice mesajele electorale prin intermediul presei. Vinzatorii au vindut, dupa cum ne-au declarat, si cite 50 de ziare deodata, unei singure persoane, care a solicitat „Ziarul de Vrancea” „cu bratul”. La ora 12.00, cititorilor care intrebau la chiscuri, la volanti sau la tarabe, de „Ziarul de Vrancea”, li se raspundea de catre vinzatori sau volanti, dind din umeri, ca s-au epuizat la primele ore ale diminetii. Doar clientii fideli ai vinzatoarelor de la chioscurile Rodipet au mai putut intra in posesia unui exemplar din publicatia noastra, pentru ca vinzatoarele le-au pastrat si le-au dat „pe sub mina”. Vinzatoarele ne-au spus ca de cind sint angajate la chioscurile de ziare nu li s-a mai intimplat ca tirajul primit de la „Ziarul de Vrancea” sa fie epuizat in mai putin de jumatate de ora. „Indiferent cine ar veni, nu dau mai mult de zece ziare! _Monitorul de Cluj_

_**Monitorul de Cluj**_ is a [Romanian language](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romanian_language) daily newspaper published in [Cluj-Napoca](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cluj-Napoca), [Romania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romania). It was first published in 26 June 1998. It is currently published by SC Monitorul de Cluj SRL, a privately owned company from Cluj-Napoca. Monitorul de Cluj is part of the media group Monitorul-Mesagerul, which is publishing the weeklies [Mesagerul de Sibiu](http://mesageruldesibiu.ro) (print and on-line), Monitorul de Arieș (print edition only), Monitorul de Mediaș (print and on-line) and [Mesagerul de Alba](http://mesageruldealba.ro) (on-line).

Monitorul de Cluj is the most read news portal in Cluj, the online extension of the daily newspaper, which has been published in Cluj since 1998. It publishes daily, in real time (24 hours a day, 7 days a week), news, reports, interviews, analyzes and investigations about all events in [Cluj County](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cluj_County), in Romania, and around the world.

input.content:
#!/bin/bash

working_domains=""
failed_domains=""

while read domain; do
    echo "Testing $domain..."
    response=$(curl -s -o /dev/null -w "%{http_code}" --connect-timeout 10 --max-time 15 "http://$domain" 2>/dev/null)
    
    if [ "$response" = "200" ] || [ "$response" = "301" ] || [ "$response" = "302" ]; then
        echo "$domain: OK ($response)"
        working_domains="$working_domains$domain\n"
    else
        echo "$domain: FAILED ($response)"
        failed_domains="$failed_domains$domain ($response)\n"
    fi
done < new_domains.txt

echo -e "$working_domains" > new_working_domains.txt
echo -e "\n--- NEW DOMAINS SUMMARY ---"
echo "Working domains saved to new_working_domains.txt"
echo "Failed domains:"
echo -e "$failed_domains"
